page.title: 15Farming in March
page.content: All the farms in our area are{arable {farms.}The main crops grown are{wheat and{potatoes.}Other crops are{barley, {sugar beet,rape and broad beans.}One farm grows{mustard}for{Colemans of {Norwich.Potatoes}go to the{local Ross {factory}or to{market}and{sugar beet}is sent to{Wissington or Peterborough. { The Walnuts farm}is owned by a retired farmer.It is on{flat land}and {each field is surrounded by drains. } { In 1956}the farmland was flooded and {a fortune was spent in laying drains {underground.}The farm has an area of 80 hectares;50ha.of{wheat,}10ha. of {barley}and 20ha.of{sugar beet.}Once the farm had pigs,bullocks and cows. Then,the farmer's wife reared ducks and chickens and made butter.Now,the {farmer owns lots of machinery}so he has{one part-time}and{one full-time {worker. }D.Butt,S.Wadlow,S.Stebbings.
